title: Creating a Common Denominator
text: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of $$m+3$$ and $$m+4$$ is $$\left(m+3\right) \left(m+4\right)$$
speech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of  m plus 3  and  m, plus 4  is  parentheses m plus 3,  times, parentheses m plus 4,
pacedSpeech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of   m plus 3
is    m plus 3,  times,  m plus 4,

title: Rewriting Each Fraction
text: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get $$\frac{4\left(m+4\right)}{\left(m+3\right) \left(m+4\right)}+\frac{3\left(m+3\right)}{\left(m+3\right) \left(m+4\right)}$$
speech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  fraction, 4 times, parentheses m plus 4, , over, parentheses m plus 3,  times, parentheses m plus 4, ,  plus fraction, 3 times, parentheses m plus 3, , over, parentheses m plus 3,  times, parentheses m plus 4, ,
pacedSpeech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  this expression

title: Adding the Fractions
speech: Adding the fractions, we get  fraction, 4 times, parentheses m plus 4,  plus, 3 times, parentheses m plus 3, , over, parentheses m plus 3,  times, parentheses m plus 4, ,
pacedSpeech: Adding the fractions, we get   fraction, 4 times,  m plus 4,  plus, 3 times,  m plus 3, , over,  m plus 3,  times,  m plus 4, ,
